column4: hi all, i have a problem now with Ubuntu 9.04 in my lappy... fan is always working at full speed!! it didnt in 8.10... what is going on?
any idea?
look at your processes
i have the BOINC software running, but i had it in 8.10 and fan was silent
use "top", "ps" and any app along those lanes and find the culprit process
is this normal?http://img689.imageshack.us/i/pantallazoelhoirelhoirl.png/
URL gave me a 404 error
works for me :S
http://img689.imageshack.us/i/pantallazoelhoirelhoirl.png/ ?
yup
Ok it did
cant tell you the real culprit here, but you need to turn many things off
and turn them on one by one noting the fan speed
for example you can start up and disable compiz
ok , disabling compiz now
i disabled desktop effects (thats a way for disabling compiz?) and no results
stop "boinc" and "firefox"
yep, i was going to stop boinc ... but, if thats the problem, why it wasnt in 8.10 ?
well, Ive no idea
aaaand, yes, suspending BOINC has slowed down fan
NOW, why it didnt make sense in 8.10?
it's different systems and things shouldve been changed
you cannot expect everything to be the same
thanks so much anyway
